_exec_summary.SummaryText:
N & D (N & D) is committed to operating in a manner that is safe for N & D employees, the public, and the environment.  As part of this commitment, N & D has established operations and management systems to help ensure safe operation of the processes at this facility. 



 One part of this system is a Risk Management Program (RMP) that helps manage chemical risk at N & D and complies with the Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) regulation 40 CFR Part 68, Accidental Release Prevention Requirements: Risk Management Program Rule (RMP Rule).  One of the requirements associated with the RMP Rule is to submit a Risk Management Plan (RMPlan) describing the risk management program at N & D's warehouse.  This document is intended to satisfy the RMPlan requirements associated with the RMP Rule and to provide the public with a description of the risk management program at N & D.



N&D Transportation Company, Inc. is a regional Less Than Truckload, Truckload, and Warehousing Company with its headquarters in North Smithfield, Rhode Island. N&D began its operations in 1991 as a truckload carrier providing service between New England and the Midwest. Today, N&D provides both Less Than Truckload (LTL) and Truckload service throughout the United States, with a focus on LTL & Truckload service in New England, New York and New Jersey and Eastern Pennsylvania. 



N&D's modern 12-acre facility consists of a 33-bay trucking terminal, with its adjacent warehouse providing secure racked freight storage. 



N & D Transportation Company, Inc. chemical operation is one of receiving, storing and shipping of a variety of chemical products in approved DOT/UN containers, including drums, plastic containers, and totes. Liquid container sizes range from 5 gallon to 250 gallon totes. All containers are DOT/UN approved. N & D Transportation Company, Inc. performs storage and distribution services only. On- site there is no blending, formulating, repackaging or opening of containers. 



Produc

t is received on pallets the majority of the time. This product is unloaded, placed in storage, and loaded onto trucks for shipment to the customer using forklifts. 

Normal Operating Conditions: 



All chemicals are stored within the warehouse at ambient pressure and temperature. Chemicals are stored on pallets then on racking within the warehouse. 

 

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies 

 

N & D is committed to the safety of N & D employees, public, and preservation of the environment, through the prevention of accidental releases of hazardous substances.  N & D implements controls to prevent   releases of hazardous substances.  In the event of a chemical release, trained personnel will respond to control and contain such releases.  N & D evaluates each situation, evacuates employees as necessary, and contacts the local fire department to control and contain the release to prevent and/or reduce the consequences of the release.  N & D will also contact Rhode Island Emergency Management Agency (EMA) to assist with emergency management if necessary.   



 Access to the site is restricted to authorized facility employees, authorized management personnel and authorized contractors. 



N & D has not had spill or release of chemicals within the past five (5) years.



The local Fire Department visited this warehouse in 2012, 2016, & 2018. The State Fire Marshall visited the warehouse on October 2018 and we are working as quickly as possible to implement his recommendations 

 

 N & D's conducts training and practice exercises on a regular basis to assure effectiveness of the emergency response program. 



N & D purchased a brand new custom warehouse turret truck - man up forklift truck in 2019

 

N & D no longer warehouses any chemical on the EPA Extremely Hazardous Substances.
